intro: Peucedanum nuttallii var. leptocarpum, commonly known as the slender fruit cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic compounds. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive parsley-like odor, while the flowers are small and white or pale green. The variety leptocarpum is distinguished by its slender, elongated fruits, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
